docs.abstract: More than 30 around the world have acted in the face of recession fears. Economists warn of a currency-tied competition.
docs.snippet: More than 30 around the world have acted in the face of recession fears. Economists warn of a currency-tied competition.
docs.lead_paragraph: More than 30 central banks around the world have cut interest rates this year, as countries move to shore up their economies amid rising concerns over global growth, trade conflicts and the threat of a messy Brexit.

headline.main: As Recession Concerns Mount, Dozens of Central Banks Are Cutting Rates
headline.print_headline: Rates Are Falling Again. That May Be Dangerous.

byline.original: By Jeanna Smialek and Karl Russell

docs.abstract: Chief executives from the Business Roundtable, including the leaders of Apple and JPMorgan Chase, argued that companies must also invest in employees and deliver value to customers.
docs.snippet: Chief executives from the Business Roundtable, including the leaders of Apple and JPMorgan Chase, argued that companies must also invest in employees and deliver value to customers.
docs.lead_paragraph: Nearly 200 chief executives, including the leaders of Apple, Pepsi and Walmart, tried on Monday to redefine the role of business in society — and how companies are perceived by an increasingly skeptical public.

headline.main: Shareholder Value Is No Longer Everything, Top C.E.O.s Say
headline.print_headline: Feeling Heat, C.E.O.s Pledge New Priorities

byline.original: By David Gelles and David Yaffe-Bellany

docs.abstract: The chief executive of Chicago Public Media succeeds Laura R. Walker, who led WNYC and related outlets for nearly 24 years.
docs.snippet: The chief executive of Chicago Public Media succeeds Laura R. Walker, who led WNYC and related outlets for nearly 24 years.
docs.lead_paragraph: The last time the New York public radio station WNYC had a new boss, in 1995, Rudolph W. Giuliani was mayor, and the station had an audience of about one million listeners a month and an operating budget of $8 million.

headline.main: New York Public Radio Names a New Leader, Goli Sheikholeslami
headline.print_headline: Public Radio In New York Announces New Leader

docs.abstract: Economists don’t know when the decade-long expansion, now the longest in American history, will end. But here are the indicators they will be watching to figure it out.
docs.snippet: Economists don’t know when the decade-long expansion, now the longest in American history, will end. But here are the indicators they will be watching to figure it out.
docs.lead_paragraph: The stock market is in turmoil, the trade war is dragging on and the global economy is slowing. Plus, it’s been 10 years since the Great Recession ended, making this officially the longest expansion in American history. (Well, probably. More on that in a second.) So perhaps it’s no surprise that forecasters, investors and ordinary people are increasingly asking when the next downturn will arrive.

headline.main: A Recession Is Coming (Eventually). Here’s Where You’ll See It First.
headline.print_headline: A Recession Is Coming (Eventually).  Here’s Where You’ll See It First.

docs.abstract: Beijing wants global companies to back its power over the city, even as their workers join protests calling for greater say in the fate of their home.
docs.snippet: Beijing wants global companies to back its power over the city, even as their workers join protests calling for greater say in the fate of their home.
docs.lead_paragraph: As Hong Kong seethes with protests against China’s rule, Beijing is increasingly pressuring the business world to take its side. Businesses, both global and local, are falling in line — and their employees are caught in the crossfire.

headline.main: China Pressures Business Over Hong Kong. Workers Get Caught in the Middle.
headline.print_headline: China Leans On Big Firms For Support Amid Strife

byline.original: By Sui-Lee Wee and Raymond Zhong

docs.abstract: The combined company would be the No. 3 automaker and have a better chance of surviving a perilous transition to electric and self-driving cars.
docs.snippet: The combined company would be the No. 3 automaker and have a better chance of surviving a perilous transition to electric and self-driving cars.
docs.lead_paragraph: The French carmaker Renault said on Monday that it was considering a proposal by Fiat Chrysler to merge and form a global partnership aimed at improving their chances of surviving the coming perilous and costly shift to electric and self-driving cars.

headline.main: Renault Considering Fiat’s Offer to Merge Into a New Auto Giant
headline.print_headline: Fiat’s Proposal to Merge Is ‘Friendly,’ Renault Says

byline.original: By Jack Ewing, Liz Alderman, Andrew Ross Sorkin and Neal E. Boudette

docs.abstract: The Japanese carmaker will have Renault’s backing to fix governance lapses, in a deal made before a key shareholder meeting.
docs.snippet: The Japanese carmaker will have Renault’s backing to fix governance lapses, in a deal made before a key shareholder meeting.
docs.lead_paragraph: Renault announced on Thursday that it had settled a core dispute in its rocky relationship with Nissan ahead of a pivotal meeting of Nissan shareholders next week in Japan, in a deal that officials hope will allow both companies to focus on strengthening the world’s largest auto alliance.

headline.main: Renault and Nissan Make Peace in a Deal to Tighten Oversight
headline.print_headline: Nissan Yields to Renault’s Demand for Seats on New Oversight Panels

docs.abstract: A lawsuit over a Los Angeles bus deal highlights the challenges of ensuring compliance with job and wage commitments that help win government work.
docs.snippet: A lawsuit over a Los Angeles bus deal highlights the challenges of ensuring compliance with job and wage commitments that help win government work.
docs.lead_paragraph: In recent decades, government agencies across the country have used their buying power to benefit American workers.

headline.main: Fraud Case Against Bus Maker Shows Risks of Pay Promises in City Contracts
headline.print_headline: Case Against Bus Maker Exposes Broken Vows

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Los Angeles County Metropolitan Transportation Authority

docs.abstract: My Mechanics Place and similar businesses provide the bay, the lift and some tools, and ambitious do-it-yourselfers take care of the rest.
docs.snippet: My Mechanics Place and similar businesses provide the bay, the lift and some tools, and ambitious do-it-yourselfers take care of the rest.
docs.lead_paragraph: LIVONIA, Mich. — A few months after Dayna Freeland bought her 2008 Ford F-150 last year, she discovered the frame was so badly rusted that it was in danger of breaking apart. Rather than storm into the used-car dealership to complain, though, she took the truck to My Mechanics Place along with an uncorroded frame she had picked up for $200 at a salvage yard.

headline.main: They Supply the Garage, You Bring the Elbow Grease

docs.abstract: Amid a severe labor shortage and a renewed U.S. crackdown on undocumented immigrants, owners are facing a choice: fire workers or risk prosecution.
docs.snippet: Amid a severe labor shortage and a renewed U.S. crackdown on undocumented immigrants, owners are facing a choice: fire workers or risk prosecution.
docs.lead_paragraph: Facing one of the most severe labor shortages in decades, restaurants across the country are trying virtually everything to recruit cooks and dishwashers, from offering quarterly bonuses to providing training programs for ex-convicts.

headline.main: Hiring Is Very Hard for Restaurants These Days. Now They May Have to Fire.
